description.p: This ring is crafted from living wood, with tiny vines and leaves that seem to shift and grow as it is worn. The centerpiece is a glowing green gem, pulsing faintly like a heartbeat. The ring was first created by an archdruid who sought to bind themselves to the cycle of life, allowing their body to recover just as the forest heals itself.
While in direct sunlight, you regain 5 hit points per round (at the start of your turn).
This regeneration does not function if you have taken fire or necrotic damage in the last round.
You have advantage on death saving throws.
You regain double the normal hit points from natural rest.
As a bonus action, you can regrow lost body parts (such as fingers, ears, or even a limb) over 1 minute.
This effect does not work on the dead, nor can it restore a severed head.
When you take bludgeoning, slashing, or piercing damage, the ring summons a protective barkskin shield, granting you temporary hit points equal to half the damage taken.
